fields.summary: LDAP Sync:  group section expects LDAP/AD attribute to be FDN instead of attribute value; fails to look up and sync users

comments.body:
Based upon our documentation for the [groups element in the LIC file|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/ag/groups.html#groups], it backs more of what the current behavior is looking at the example we provide:

{code}
filter: The LDAP/AD searching filter used for the LDAP/AD search to get the relevant LDAP/AD entities, e.g. the users to be synchronized. (Example: objectClass=groupOfNames)

select: The LDAP/AD searching filter used for the LDAP/AD search to get the relevant LDAP/AD entities, e.g. the users to be synchronized. (Example: objectClass=groupOfNames)
{code}

[_objectclass=groupOfNames_|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4519#page-22] has the following attributes that NEED to be defined as part of the object:

* cn
* member

[_member_|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4519#page-11] attribute is defined as follows:

{code}
( 2.5.4.31 NAME 'member'
         SUP distinguishedName )
{code}

Examples: "cn=James Clarke,ou=Finance,o=Widget\, Inc." and "cn=John Xerri,ou=Finance,o=Widget\, Inc." may be two members of the financial team (group) at Widget, Inc., in which case, both of these distinguished names would be present as individual values of the member attribute.

In short, we assume the _member-attribute_ to contain values of FDN(s).
Also need to document the object group types we support.  [~hspencer] to do
Marking so this will hit the Eng bug scrub.
DOC-820 gives insight as to what group object class types we support due to the requirement of providing the FDN of users as part of group membership.
DOC-824 provides insight as to the relationship of _accounting-groups_, _groups-partitions_, _users_, and _groups_ to the LIC file, and to LDAP/AD.
[~hspencer]Has this been confirmed against 3.4?
I just verified that his is still an Issue in 3.4 I am investigating.

Hey [~mmunn1],

I attached atliens-v2.lic file for regression testing.  The groups uses FQN for membership. 

To use it, after downloading, you will need to run the following command to generate a lic file with the correctly encrypted password:

{code}
$euca-lictool --password password --custom atliens-v2.lic --out mynew.lic --nocomment
{code}

After that, you just need to use _euca-modify-property_ to enable the LDAP sync.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Code Review Request :  EUCA-5876 LDAP Sync: group section expects LDAP/AD attribute to be FDN instead of attribute value; fails to look up and sync users

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-5876

diff :  git show --color 6e4b3d94e228c9b7fdd803533065ee67da299f2e

Summary: LDAP sync fails to sync users at LdapSync.getMembers(...) and throws error: 
"Can not map member DN user100 to ID for {memberuid=memberUid: user01" 

Solution: Use input parameter "attrs" instead of the dnToId map as as "attrs"
already has the retrieved userIds.

unit test: See Harrolds Comments from  07/Oct/13 2:28 PM in Jira.
I have created testcase ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/3-4/Euca5876

What is the goal for this issue? Are we changing our requirement for the LDAP schema so that group memberships are no longer expected to be DNs? or are we aiming to support both the case of DNs and other identifiers for memberships?

Hey [~sjones],

The goal here IMO is to support both.  LDAP/AD has the ability to use both as membership identifiers, so this helps with LDAP/AD integration with Eucalyptus.  Does this help?

[~sjones], [~hspencer]
This fix does not change the requirement for the LDAP schema. If you run the test for described by Harold above with the fix in place you will see in the admin gui that  the
account, group, and users as well as the user information is mapped correctly i.e:
Email=user46@twodopeboyz.atliens.com
saslid=user46
dn uid=user46,ou=people,dc=twodopeboyz,dc=atliens,dc=com
Full Name=user 46
Title=test user 46

Without the fix no users are created in Eucalyptus, just the account and the group.

I think we'd need an additional LIC option to define what the expected mapping is for memberships (DN or identity). We would then map the value or not, depending on the option to allow both use cases to be supported.
[~sjones] I am not real familiar with ldap where would the expected mapping be defined?
Tnx Steve,  I will take a look.
[~sjones], [~hspencer] I am unclear on the two different use cases?  Are the two use cases defined by different lic file configurations?

The use cases are for different LDAP schemas:

* member: cn=user1,ou=dept,dc=example,dc=com cn=user2,ou=dept,dc=example,dc=com
* member: user1 user2

So in the first case membership is recorded in ldap by a multi-valued attribute (member), each item is the DN of a user (or account for accounting groups). The second case is the new one where the membership is defined by some other attribute, which we are assuming is the one defined by "id-attribute" in the LIC.

The new LIC property would define what we expect to find in the member attribute so we know if we need to map from a DN to an id or if we just need to sanitize the values and use them without mapping (i.e. different strategies for the two possibilities)
[~hspencer], right. I think if we want to support both DNs and identifiers for membership then an explicit setting is the best approach (with a backwards compatible default value)

Ok so "memberUid" is a multi-valued attribute with "members'" being either DNs or identifiers depending on the LDAP schema. I assume the default is the DN, so that if "member-item-type" is not defied at all then DN is used, or do we want to force the definition of "member-item-type" in the lic file? We will need to doc this as well.

New Code Review Request :  EUCA-5876 LDAP Sync: group section expects LDAP/AD attribute to be FDN instead of attribute value; fails to look up and sync users

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-5876

diff :  git show --color fcdc7ed0ed0362f84710d8af33c0cbb60093b4e5

Summary: LDAP sync fails to sync users at LdapSync.getMembers(...) and throws error: 
"Can not map member DN user100 to ID for {memberuid=memberUid: user01" 
The problem is that some LDAP Schemas return the "dn" for memberUid and some return the user identity.

Solution: Added lic group parameter member-item-type with a default of "dn" this does not change current
behavior. if member-item-type is set to "identity" the memberId is mapped directly to the "identity". 

unit test: See Harrolds Comments from  07/Oct/13 2:28 PM in Jira.
I have created testcase ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/3-4/Euca5876

[~mmunn1], it looks like the fix covers groups but not accounting groups which is inconsistent but perhaps not important to address for this issue. We need to sanitize the id value (i.e. call "sanitizeUserGroupId" on the "memberId" for the "identity" case)
[~shaon], note that configuration is required to specify the expected group membership attribute value type.

[~mdshaonimran] Steve is correct, If you compare the atliens-euca5876.lic with the ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/3-4/euca7879.lic  included with the estester you will note the new "groups" parameter  "member-item-type":"identity".   The default for "member-item-type" is "dn" if this new property is not set.  The fix will only work with "member-item-type" set to "identity".  Take a look at the new  "lic_template" included with this commit and mentioned in http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/admin-guide/access_lic.html.

Thanks [~sjones], [~mmunn1].

Tested with [euca5876.lic | https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester/blob/testing/testcases/cloud_admin/3-4/euca5876.lic], worked fine.
